author: Amazon Customer

review: Chromecast was a good investment. It's portable. I can take it with me anywhere that has WiFi. I can mirror everything on my phone to the TV. It's nice to watch YouTube on the big screen. It's also nice that I can watch HBO, Starz, Showtime, etc anywhere because U-Verse has Chromecast support and I'm an AT&T; subscriber. Right now I'm streaming Netflix so my nephew can watch shows while I play on my phone. It doesn't interfere. Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because it can be glitchy at times and that there are many services that aren't supported by Chromecast. But, many are still being added to the list. This is surprising due to Google's release of Android TV. I'm glad they haven't forgotten about Chromecast. Also, I've had a Roku for years. Both have pros and cons. My Roku is the first model, so it wouldn't be fair to do a full comparison. One would need at least a Roku LT being as it is the latest model closest to the Chromecast's price point. And I got $20 credit on the GooglePlay store for buying. All in all, it's a great device at a very reasonable price. I wish I would have a long time ago.
author: J.Smitty

review: Initially, I was a bit apprehensive in purchasing this dongle device for our family room tv. However, I have yet to be disappointed in the results thus far.Chromecast is what it is, it's a streaming device primarily geared towards Google applications and some independent ones such Netflix and HBOGO, if you have an HBO cable subscription at the moment, it streams from your Android phone and/or tablet, your chromebook, or your Windows 7 laptop, I'm not sure it will work on an 8/8.1 because I haven't had to use the chromecast extension on chrome on said OS.At any rate, you get what you pay for and for a $35 media dongle, it satisfies my streaming needs quite well. Be warned there's a slight delay when you start streaming anything be it movies, music, etc., so don't freak out if a movie or tv show on Netflix doesn't start immediately. Just give it a few seconds and it'll start, then again, it may also depend on your router and whether it's designed to handle high-end media streaming and downloads.I recommend this as a solid holiday gift for the family or for a student in a dorm, if he/she has a "dumb HDTV." Can't go wrong with inexpensive practicality.
